page.title: 11Trout farming by R Bulbourne
page.content: This farm is by the River Bulbourne and was originally a water cress farm, a little of which is still sold direct to the public. The family bought the farm about 120 years ago. In the 1890's the owner's grandfather pur down 15 wells to provide running water for the cress. These now feed 15 tanks which vary between 6 and 10 ft deep. Trout farming was started 8 years ago and both rainbow and brown trout are raised together with carp. They spawn their own trout but not carp as yet. The trout are usually killed and sold when they weigh \-1\lbs. Excess trout are smoked. The fish are sold direct from the farm. The fish are fed on high protein pellets. Rainbow trout costs about Â£1.20 plb and brown about Â£1.40. This varies according to feed prices.
